modules.description: This module defines a set of recursive box structures like `Text`, `Hlist`, `Vlist`, and `Table`, along with operations to build and transform them. It supports tree conversions via `of_ktree` and `map_ktree`, and formatting text content using `sprintf` and `asprintf`. These structures are used to declaratively compose and render nested textual layouts, such as pretty-printing code or structured data.

This module defines styling attributes for text rendering, including foreground and background colors, bold formatting, and preformatted text. It supports operations to create and modify styles with specific visual properties. Use cases include customizing terminal output appearance, such as highlighting errors in red or formatting code blocks with monospace rendering.

This module enables constructing and styling text-based layout elements for terminal output, supporting operations like framing, padding, alignment, and composing grids, lists, or trees. It works with structured text components, allowing precise control over spacing, positioning, and visual attributes such as colors or bold text, and is suited for generating formatted terminal UIs, tables, or hierarchical data visualizations. Additional features include HTML link embedding, declarative nested layout composition, and utilities for mapping styled text to complex hierarchical structures like trees or records.
